actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-868, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5754 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 8 of rule XXI are waived. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Public Works and Transportation now printed in the bill, and modified by the amendments printed in part 1 of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution. Measure will be considered read. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the amendment printed in part 2 of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution if offered by either Mr. Fazio or Mr. Mats...
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 200.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 269 - 141 (Roll no. 414).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5754) to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the United States Army Corps of Engineers civil works program to construct various projects for improvements to the Nation's infrastructure, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5754 (water resources development).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5754) to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the United States Army Corps of Engineers civil works program to construct various projects for improvements to the Nation's infrastructure, and for other purposes.
